body.p: Lawyer and state militia officer prior to the Civil War. Born in Lincoln County, Kentucky in 1827. During the Mexican-American War he enlisted as a lieutenant the 4th Kentucky Infantry. Admitted to the Kentucky bar in 1853. In 1861, he was commissioned a colonel and raised the 25th Kentucky Volunteers. In 1862 took command of the 8th Kentucky Cavalry. In 1863 promoted to Brigadier General, and placed in command of the 1st Brigade in the Army of the Ohio. Resigned in January 1864, and resumed his legal practice.
